titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bernard Frank Dukore Collection of Peter Barnes
Dukore (Bernard Frank) Collection of Peter Barnes
titlestmt.author: by Jennifer Meehan and Santana Haight

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 03:07

did.unittitle: Bernard Frank Dukore Collection of Peter Barnes

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material relating to Peter Barnes, which was created and accumulated by Bernard Frank Dukore in the course of his research on the work of the British dramatist and screenwriter. Material includes incoming and copies of outgoing correspondence between Dukore and Barnes, dating from 1978 to 2004; copies and typescripts of original plays, adaptations, and scripts by Peter Barnes, some of which are inscribed or annotated; audio recordings of BBC productions of Barnes's plays and copies of commercially-released films and television programs featuring scripts by Barnes on VHS and DVD-R; photographs and programs relating to the production of Barnes's plays; correspondence between Dukore and Gisele Joly, the French translator of Barnes's play Red Noses; transcripts of interviews with Barnes conducted by Dukore; and numerous clippings and photocopies of published writings by Barnes and about Barnes by Dukore.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bernard Frank Dukore on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2008, and gift of Bernard Frank Dukore, 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 7 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 9 (electronic documents): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Bernard Frank Dukore Collection of Peter Barnes is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bernard Frank Dukore Collection of Peter Barnes. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received a basic level of processing upon receipt in 2008, including simple preservation and organization.

bioghist.head: Peter Barnes (1931-2004)
bioghist.p: Peter Barnes was a British dramatist, screenwriter, and film critic. His plays include The Ruling Class: A Baroque Comedy (1969), which was made into a film starring Peter O'Toole in 1972, Leonardo's Last Supper (1970), The Bewitched (1974), Red Noses (1985), Sunsets and Glories (1990), and Jubilee (2001). His screenplays include an adaptation of Elizabeth von Arnim's novel Enchanted April , for which he received an Academy Award nomination in 1992.

bioghist.head: Bernard Frank Dukore (1931-)
bioghist.p: Bernard Frank Dukore was a professor of drama and theater at the University of Hawaii from 1972 to 1986, and a University Distinguished professor of Theatre Arts and Humanities at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University from 1986 to 1997. He is the author of The Theatre of Peter Barnes (1981), American Dramatists, 1918-1945 (1984), and Barnestorm: The Plays of Peter Barnes (1995), as well as numerous other books, essays, and articles on theater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material relating to Peter Barnes, which was created and accumulated by Bernard Frank Dukore in the course of his research on the work of the British dramatist and screenwriter. Material includes incoming and copies of outgoing correspondence between Dukore and Barnes, dating from 1978 to 2004; copies and typescripts of original plays, adaptations, and scripts by Peter Barnes, some of which are inscribed or annotated; audio recordings of BBC productions of Barnes's plays and copies of commercially-released films and television programs featuring scripts by Barnes on VHS and DVD-R; photographs and programs relating to the production of Barnes's plays; correspondence between Dukore and Gisele Joly, the French translator of Barnes's play Red Noses; transcripts of interviews with Barnes conducted by Dukore; and numerous clippings and photocopies of published writings by Barnes and about Barnes by Dukore.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1978-2004. II. Writings by Peters Barnes, 1960-2004. III. Audio-Visual Material, 1976-1992. IV. Other Papers, 1958-2007. This organization is largely based upon the order in which the material was received by the library.

did.unittitle: Correspondence between Peter Barnes and Bernard F. Dukore

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of copies and typescripts of final versions of original plays, adaptations, and scripts by Barnes, some of which are inscribed by Barnes or annotated by either Barnes or Dukore.
